text: Rafailia Spanoudaki-Hatziriga (; born 7 June 1994), is a Greek sprinter. She competed in the 60 metres event at the 2018 IAAF World Indoor Championships. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2017 |European Indoor Championships |Belgrade, Serbia | – |60 m |DQ False start |- |rowspan=4|2018 |World Indoor Championships |Birmingham, United Kingdom |35th (h) |60 m |7.40 s |- |Mediterranean Games |Tarragona, Spain |bgcolor=silver|2nd |100 m |11.53 s |- |rowspan=2|European Championships |rowspan=2|Berlin, Germany |16th (h) |100 m |11.63 s |- |14th (h) |4×100 m relay |44.48 s |- |rowspan=2|2019 |European Indoor Championships |Glasgow, United Kingdom | – |60 m |DQ False start |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar | 34th (h) |200 m |23.48 s |- |} ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Greek female sprinters Category:Mediterranean Games silver medalists for Greece Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in athletics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2018 Mediterranean Games Category:European Games competitors for Greece Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 European Games Category:European Games medalists in athletics Category:European Games bronze medalists for Greece
title: Rafaéla Spanoudaki-Hatziriga
